business_hypothesis: Rebilled and split-bill orders create timing friction and arithmetic drift that delay revenue recognition and increase reconciliation error rates.
science_hypothesis: rebilled=Y and is_split_bill=Y have an interaction that reduces immediate invoice probability and increases median ship_date→bill_date by >7 days; interaction term in Cox/survival and logistic models is significant (p < 0.01) and explains measurable charge mismatches where total_charges_n != linehaul_chg_n + other_charge_n in >2% of rebilled/split orders.
null_case: Rebilling and split-bill flags have no joint effect: median ship_date→bill_date difference between rebilled/split and control groups is ≤ 1 day, interaction term not significant (p > 0.10), and arithmetic mismatches occur at baseline error rate (<0.5%).

validation_methods.execution_plan: Compute median and mean days from ship_date to bill_date stratified by rebilled and is_split_bill flags (four cells) and perform median tests and Mann-Whitney U tests for differences; also compute per-order mismatch rate where total_charges_n differs from linehaul_chg_n + other_charge_n by > $1 or >1% relative. The detector passes if rebilled & split cell shows median delay ≥ 7 days larger than control with p < 0.01 and mismatch rate in that cell > 2%.

For orders with is_split_bill=Y, compute reconciliation metrics: proportion of orders with rounding/aggregation variance, proportion requiring manual adjustment, and distribution of difference = total_charges_n - (linehaul_chg_n + other_charge_n). The scanner passes if reconciliation-adjustment orders exceed 2% of split-bill orders and mean absolute difference > $5 or >1% of order value.

Run a Cox proportional hazards model for time-to-invoice with covariates rebilled, is_split_bill and their interaction, controlling for total_charges_n and customer_id strata; report hazard ratios, p-values, and concordance. The referee passes if the interaction yields hazard ratio ≤ 0.7 (indicating at least 30% slower time-to-invoice), p < 0.01 and model concordance ≥ 0.70, with parameter stability across bootstrap samples.
